p.s: The tragedy Romeo and Juliet written by William Shakespeare and published in 1597 tells the love story of two young people from rival families that ends with the deaddeath of both lovers.
The given extract from Act II scene 2 is about Romeo's and Juliet's secret conversation in the Capulet's garden.
Romeo came to see his beloved one, but as he comes out of hiding Juliet shares her worries with him.
Juliet tells Romeo her relatives may find and therefore kill him, but Romeo is not bothered by this danger and tries to calm Juliet down by opening up and charming her with his feelings.
Romeo assures anxious Juliet he will not be seen, but she resists on continuing to ask why he came to her garden and has brought himself in such a miserable and dangerous situation.
After Romeo answers her questions lovingly again Juliet seems to slowly feel comfortable and starts to respond to Romeo in the same loving way.
At this point the scene takes a turn as until here Juliet mostly asks short questions or states her worries and Romeo talks about his feelings a lot more.
From this moment on though Juliet says a long paragraph about her feelings for Romeo and how she cannot resist him and Romeo only seems to answer Juliet in this part of the scene.
Both Romeo and Juliet state their love to each other as the scene comes to an end.
